news.title: MS Student Inwoo Tae Selected for NRF Graduate Research Fellowship
news.title_kr: 석사과정 태인우, 한국연구재단 석사과정생 연구장려금지원 선정
news.summary: Inwoo Tae, MS student, has been selected for the National Research Foundation of Korea's Graduate Research Fellowship program for his research on dynamic embedding techniques for financial text data.
news.content:
MS student Inwoo Tae has been selected for the National Research Foundation of Korea's Graduate Research Fellowship program with his research topic "Development and Analysis of Dynamic Embedding Techniques for Capturing Temporal Changes in Financial Text Data."

Please join us in congratulating Inwoo on this achievement!

news.title: Prof. Yongjae Lee Invited Speaker at KDD 2024 Finance Day
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, KDD 2024 Finance Day 초청 발표
news.summary: Professor Yongjae Lee delivered an invited talk at the KDD 2024 Finance Day, presenting recent research on machine learning applications in quantitative finance.
news.content:
Professor Yongjae Lee participated and presented at KDD 2024 Finance Day. [figure1]
 He introduced research conducted previously with Shinhan Investment & Securities, as well as ongoing research being planned with KB Securities.
[figure2]

The presentation covered two main research areas: 1) analyzing how diverse individual investors are and what different characteristics they possess, and 2) research on how to utilize optimization and machine learning to assist such diverse individual investors in their investment decisions.

news.title: Dr. Yoontae Hwang and Prof. Lee Win Best Paper Award at KAMS 2024
news.title_kr: 황윤태 박사, 이용재 교수, 2024 한국경영학회 최우수논문상 수상
news.summary: Dr. Yoontae Hwang and Prof. Yongjae Lee received the Best Paper Award at the 2024 Korean Academic Society of Business Administration conference for their work on financial representation learning.
news.content:
[figure1]

Dr. Yoontae Hwang, Prof. Yongjae Lee, and Prof. Stefan Zohren from the University of Oxford have received the Best Paper Award at the 2024 Korean Academic Society of Business Administration (KAMS) conference for their paper "Temporal Representation learning for Stock Similarities and Its Applications in Investment Management."

Congratulations![figure2]

news.title: IJCAI-24 Workshop on Recommender Systems in Finance
news.title_kr: IJCAI-24 Workshop on Recommender Systems in Finance (Fin-RecSys)
news.summary: Our lab presented research at the IJCAI-24 Workshop on Recommender Systems in Finance, focusing on temporal graph networks for stock recommendations.
news.content: [figure1] We hosted the IJCAI-24 Workshop on Recommender Systems in Finance (Fin-RecSys) on August 4, 2024, at the Jeju International Convention Center. Keynote Talks: Prof. Bo An (NTU, Singapore) delivered a keynote on deep reinforcement learning for quantitative trading. He introduced numerous research projects in this field and impressively demonstrated his commitment to advancing the field by making all code and learning environments publicly available. Dr. Chung-Chi Chen (AIST, Japan) presented various research approaches for estimating the quality and relevance of financial opinions using NLP. While financial NLP typically focuses on sentiment analysis, his presentation offered valuable alternative perspectives. Invited Talks: Dr. Seongho Eun (Hana Institute of Technology) introduced methods for designing personalized loan products using internal transaction data. Dr. Sang Hyun Park (Hana Institute of Technology) presented a machine learning-based automated system for real-time phishing app detection. Accepted Papers: Lubingzhi Guo (University of Glasgow) introduced methods for constructing financial knowledge graphs from financial reports and Wikidata, demonstrating their effectiveness in asset return prediction. Prof. Richard McCreadie (University of Glasgow) introduced FAR-Trans, a rare public dataset containing individual investor transaction records, created in collaboration with the National Bank of Greece to advance research on individual investors. Yejin Kim (UNIST) proposed a temporal graph network approach for stock recommendations that simultaneously considers individual investor preferences and portfolio diversification. Dae-Young Park (Financial Security Institute) proposed a graph-based tabular data synthesis model for financial fraud detection data, focusing on handling class imbalance and non-normal distributions. Youngjin Park (KAIST) introduced a method to significantly improve SHAP computation speed using surrogates, with a case study on financial product recommendation datasets. Namhyoung Kim (Hanyang University) proposed a method that clusters assets by risk level and selects assets based on momentum within each risk cluster. Organizing Committee: Yongjae Lee (UNIST, Korea), John Thompson (University of British Columbia, Canada), Dhagash Mehta, Ph.D. (BlackRock, US), Thomas De Luca (Vanguard, US), Richard McCreadie (University of Glasgow, UK), Jaesik Choi (KAIST, Korea), Min Hee Kim (Hana Institute of Technology, Korea).

news.title: UNIST Signs MOU with Korea Credit Information Services
news.title_kr: UNIST-한국신용정보원 업무협약 체결
news.summary: UNIST and Korea Credit Information Services signed an MOU for collaborative research on synthetic data generation for credit information and AI applications in finance.
news.content:
[figure1]

UNIST and Korea Credit Information Services (KCIS) signed a business agreement for collaborative research on synthetic data generation and evaluation methods.

According to Director Choi Yu-sam of KCIS, the institution serves as a reservoir where all credit information of companies and individuals converges. UNIST Dean Sim Jae-young emphasized that for ML/AI to achieve genuine growth in specific fields, three elements must work in harmony: AI experts, domain experts, and data.

news.title: Prof. Lee Presents at QRAFT AI Finance Conference and HF Housing Finance Conference
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, QRAFT AI Finance Conference, 주택금융공사 창립 20주년 기념 HF 주택금융 컨퍼런스 초청 발표
news.summary: Professor Lee delivered invited talks at two major finance conferences, discussing AI applications in asset management and housing finance.
news.content:
[figure1]

[figure2]

Professor Lee participated in a presentation and panel discussion at the AI Finance Conference 2024 hosted by QRAFT on May 24th.

On May 31st, he delivered a keynote presentation at the 2024 HF Housing Finance Conference commemorating the 20th anniversary of Korea Housing Finance Corporation, presenting on the topic "Hyper-personalization: The Future of Artificial Intelligence and Housing Finance."[figure3]

[figure4]

news.title: Yoontae Hwang and Dr. Hyungwoo Kong Selected for Sejong Science Fellowship
news.title_kr: 석박통합과정 황윤태, 박사후연구원 공형우 박사 세종과학펠로우십 선정!
news.summary: PhD candidate Yoontae Hwang and postdoctoral researcher Dr. Hyungwoo Kong have been selected for the prestigious Sejong Science Fellowship. This highly competitive fellowship recognizes outstanding early-career researchers and provides substantial research funding for independent research projects. Their selection reflects the excellence of research conducted at our lab.
news.content:
Yoontae Hwang, the first student to join the UNIST FE Lab and currently in his 4.5th year of the integrated PhD program, and Dr. Hyungwoo Kong, who joined as a postdoctoral researcher in early 2024, have been selected for the Sejong Science Fellowship!

Yoontae has been selected for the overseas research track and will begin his postdoctoral research under the guidance of Professor Stefan Zohren at Oxford University starting in August, following his defense in June.

Dr. Kong has been selected for the general track and will receive research funding support for 3+2 years.

Please join us in congratulating both of them![figure1]

[figure2]

[figure3]

news.title: Prof. Lee Appointed to FSC AI Council and Future Finance Task Force
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, 금융위원회 '금융권 AI 협의회', '미래대응금융 TF' 위원 위촉
news.summary: Professor Yongjae Lee has been appointed as a member of the Financial Services Commission's AI Council and Future Finance Task Force.
news.content:
Professor Yongjae Lee has been appointed to serve as a committee member of the Financial Services Commission's AI Council and the Technology Subcommittee of the Future Finance Task Force, starting from March 2024.[figure1]

[figure2]

news.title: Prof. Lee Invited Speaker at AAAI-24 Bridge Program on AI for Financial Services
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, AAAI-24 Bridge Program on AI for Financial Services 초청 발표
news.summary: Professor Lee presented at the AAAI-24 Bridge Program, discussing recent advances in AI applications for financial services.
news.content:
[figure1]

Professor Lee delivered an invited talk at the AAAI-24 Bridge Program on AI for Financial Services, presenting recent advances in AI applications for financial services.

news.title: MS Students Win Best Poster Award at ICAIF'23
news.title_kr: 석사과정 김선미, 김세영, 김예진 등 ICAIF'23 Best Poster Award 수상!
news.summary: MS students Seonmi Kim, Seyoung Kim, and Yejin Kim received the Best Poster Award at the 4th ACM International Conference on AI in Finance (ICAIF'23) for their work 'LLMs Analyzing Analysts: Do BERT and GPT Extract More Value from Financial Analyst Reports?'. This recognition highlights our lab's excellence in applying large language models to financial analysis.
news.content:
[figure1]

UNIST FE Lab MS students Seonmi Kim, Seyoung Kim, and Yejin Kim received the Best Poster Award at The 4th ACM International Conference on AI in Finance (ICAIF'23), held from November 27-29, 2023. Congratulations!

Special thanks go to Yoontae Hwang, Youngbin Lee, and Junhyung Lee for their efforts in securing votes at the conference.

Please join us in congratulating all the team members on this outstanding achievement!

news.title: ICAIF'23 Workshop on ML for Investor Modelling and Recommender Systems
news.title_kr: ICAIF'23 Workshop on ML for Investor Modelling and Recommender Systems
news.summary: Our lab organized and participated in the ICAIF'23 workshop focusing on machine learning applications for investor modeling.
news.content: [figure1] Professor Yongjae Lee served as co-organizer for the ICAIF'23 Workshop on ML for Investor Modelling and Recommender Systems, successfully held in Brooklyn, New York on November 27, 2023. [figure2] Keynotes: Prof. Lin William Cong (Cornell University) presented on how AI can assist investment through goal-oriented search approaches. Prof. Andrea Kő (Corvinus University) analyzed investment service customer survey data using neuro-fuzzy approaches, providing interpretations from various perspectives. Dr. Han-Tai Shiao (Vanguard) demonstrated how Vanguard uses recommender systems to help financial advisors suggest topics of interest to clients based on their preferences, thereby improving service quality. Prof. Richard McCreadie (University of Glasgow) discussed the differences and limitations between price-based recommendations and transaction-record-based recommendations. Accepted Papers: Paul Nixon (Momentum Investments) presented on predicting customer fund switching behavior using machine learning. Youngbin Lee (UNIST) addressed how to effectively combine price-based and transaction-record-based recommendations using temporal graph networks with diversification-enhancing contrastive learning. Invited Presentations: Dr. Jong-Ha Jeon and Dr. Seulki Kim (Hana Institute of Finance Technology) presented on developing credit evaluation models through machine learning and related challenges. Seongmin Jang (NC Soft Financial Technology Development) discussed developing systems for efficient portfolio rebalancing without compromising customer preferences. In his closing remarks, Professor Lee emphasized that developing theories and services for individual investors requires capturing three key elements: portfolio diversification (stable diversified investment), consumption goals (retirement preparation, children's education, medical expenses, etc.), and individual preferences (investment style, preferred sectors, ESG considerations, etc.). He noted that while the first two have been extensively addressed through mathematical optimization, individual preferences have been well-researched in the recommender systems field, and these should be effectively combined for better research and service development. Presentation slides and papers will be made available on the workshop website.

news.title: Prof. Lee Receives Excellence in Teaching Award
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수님 우수교원상 수상!

news.content:
[figure1]

Lab students participated in celebrating this achievement by presenting a bouquet of flowers and enjoying lunch together to congratulate Professor Lee.

[figure2]

news.title: MS Students Youngbin Lee and Yejin Kim Accepted to 2023 CMU AI Program

[figure2]

news.title: Prof. Lee Presents at Fields Workshop on ML for Investor Modeling
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, Fields Workshop on ML for Investor Modeling 발표
news.summary: Professor Lee delivered a presentation at the Fields Institute Workshop on Machine Learning for Investor Modeling.
news.content: Professor Yongjae Lee presented at the Workshop on ML for Investor Modeling held at the Fields Institute from February 16-17, 2023. His presentation was titled "Household Financial Health: A Machine Learning Approach."

news.title: FE Lab Wins Multiple Competition Awards
news.title_kr: UNIST FE Lab 경진대회 연달아 수상!! (황윤태, 박준표, 이영빈)
news.summary: Lab members Yoontae Hwang, Junpyo Park, and Youngbin Lee won awards in multiple data science and finance competitions.
news.content: On December 17, 2022, students Junpyo Park and Youngbin Lee won the Excellence Award in the ETF Managed Portfolio category at 'Research Academia 2022'! [figure1] [figure2] On December 21, 2022, students Yoontae Hwang, Junpyo Park, and Youngbin Lee won the Excellence Award in the 'Data Analysis League' category at the '2022 Big Contest'! [figure3] [figure4] Please join us in congratulating all the award winners on their outstanding achievements!

news.title: Prof. Lee Speaks at Korea Quant Investment Conference
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, 한국 퀀트투자 컨퍼런스 발표 (마이데이터와 맞춤형 금융 서비스)
news.summary: Professor Lee presented on 'MyData and Personalized Financial Services' at the Korea Quant Investment Conference.
news.content:
[figure1]

Professor Yongjae Lee presented at the 6th Korea Quant Investment Conference hosted by S&P Global and the Korea Quantitative Investment Association, with the title "Customer-Tailored Investment Design Using Financial MyData."

The presentation covered the changes that MyData will bring to financial services and introduced current research being conducted at the UNIST Financial Engineering Lab in this area.

news.title: Yoontae Hwang Presents at BigStar Competition Seminar
news.title_kr: 석박통합과정 황윤태, 빅스타 경진대회 연계 세미나 발표 (장기 시계열 예측 최신연구동향)

news.content: Lab leader Yoontae Hwang, who has been diligently studying long-term time series research, was invited by AI Factory to present on related research trends at the BigStar Competition Seminar.

news.title: Yoontae Hwang Selected for NRF Doctoral Research Fellowship
news.title_kr: 석박통합과정 황윤태, 한국연구재단 박사과정생 연구장려금지원 선정

news.content:
PhD candidate Yoontae Hwang has been selected for the National Research Foundation's Doctoral Research Fellowship program with his research topic "Personalized Asset Management Process through Household Financial Health Index."

Congratulations!

news.title: Students Win Excellence Award at Mirae Asset Financial Big Data Festival
news.title_kr: 석사과정 권소현, 최민주, 학부 인턴 김세영 '미래에셋 금융 빅데이터 페스티벌' 장려상 수상
news.summary: MS students Sohyeon Kwon, Minjoo Choi, and undergraduate intern Seyoung Kim won the Excellence Award at the Mirae Asset Financial Big Data Festival.
news.content:
MS students Sohyeon Kwon, Minjoo Choi, and undergraduate intern Seyoung Kim participated in the 2021 Mirae Asset Financial Big Data Festival and won the Excellence Award (prize money: 1 million KRW).

They participated in the AICP program to conduct research on 'GAN-based Asset Allocation' and competed with this research. They were selected as one of the top 6 teams in the 'TIGER ETF Investment Strategy Development' category and advanced to the finals.

Congratulations![figure1]

news.title: Prof. Lee Delivers Invited Seminar at Korea Insurance Research Institute
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, 보험연구원 초청 세미나 발표 (AI 자산관리와 보험)
news.summary: Professor Lee presented on 'AI Asset Management and Insurance' at an invited seminar at the Korea Insurance Research Institute.
news.content: Professor Lee was invited to present at the Korea Insurance Research Institute industry-academia seminar on April 30, 2021, with the topic 'AI Asset Management and Insurance.' He briefly introduced some of the research topics currently being conducted in the lab and had discussions with the panel members.[figure1]

news.title: FE Lab Welcomes New Graduate Students
news.title_kr: UNIST FE Lab, 석박통합과정 박준표, 석사과정 권소현, 최민주 영입
news.summary: The lab welcomes new members: PhD candidate Junpyo Park and MS students Sohyeon Kwon and Minjoo Choi.
news.content:
[figure1]

Three very capable and passionate students have joined the lab, bringing the total number of students in the UNIST Financial Engineering Lab to four. Now that we have formed a proper group, we hope that everyone will get along well together while pursuing their individual goals.

news.title: Yoontae Hwang Receives Commissioner's Award from Statistics Korea
news.title_kr: 석박통합과정 황윤태, 데이터 분석대회에서 통계청장 표창
news.summary: PhD candidate Yoontae Hwang received the Commissioner's Award from Statistics Korea in a national data analysis competition.
news.content:
[figure1]

Financial Engineering Lab leader Yoontae Hwang, along with Kyeongbin Kim and Dongcheol Lim from the Data Mining Lab (Professor Jeonghye Lee), participated in the 2020 Statistical Data Analysis and Utilization Competition and received the Commissioner's Award from Statistics Korea.

Congratulations!

news.title: UNIST Industrial Engineering Signs MOU with KOSCOM
news.title_kr: UNIST 산업공학과 - 코스콤 MOU 체결
news.summary: UNIST Department of Industrial Engineering signed an MOU with KOSCOM for collaboration in financial technology research.
news.content: UNIST Department of Industrial Engineering and KOSCOM signed an MOU for educational and research collaboration. Starting from 2021, KOSCOM's big data analysis platform will be piloted in courses offered by our lab.

news.title: UNIST Financial Engineering Lab in the Making
news.title_kr: UNIST FE Lab in the making
news.summary: The foundations of UNIST Financial Engineering Lab are being established with initial research directions and infrastructure.
news.content: [figure1] At the end of August 2020, the UNIST Department of Industrial Engineering began moving to Building 112 (5th Engineering Building), and the Financial Engineering Lab (Director: Professor Yongjae Lee) came to share an entrance with the Data Mining Lab (Director: Professor Jeonghye Lee). For efficient space utilization, it was decided to have a shared common area in the middle that both lab students would use together. We hope that this shared space between the two labs will become a place of peace and prosperity, cooperation and mutual benefit. 2020.08.25 Desks being moved into the neighboring lab (Professor Jeonghye Lee's lab) [figure2] [figure3] 2020.08.31 Common area refrigerator, coffee table, etc. arrived [figure4] [figure5] [figure6] 2020.09.02 Partition installation on both sides completed [figure7] [figure8] [figure9] 2020.09.03 Desks, chairs, and sofas arrived [figure10] [figure11] [figure12] 2020.09.04 Peace agreement restored and JSA installation completed Due to incorrect sofa placement, the peace agreement with Professor Jeonghye Lee's lab was briefly in crisis, but the FE Lab side quickly rearranged the sofas and desks to restore the peace agreement and established a Joint Security Area (JSA) where both sides can freely move across the demarcation line. [figure13] 2020.09.11 Partition installation and relocation completed[figure14] [figure15]

news.title: Yoontae Hwang Becomes First Student to Join UNIST FE Lab
news.title_kr: 황윤태, UNIST FE Lab 첫 번째 학생으로 합류
news.summary: Yoontae Hwang joins as the first student of UNIST Financial Engineering Lab, marking the beginning of the lab's journey.
news.content:
[figure1]

Yoontae Hwang has joined as the first student of UNIST FE Lab. Known for his ambitious statements, he brings high expectations to the lab. We hope that UNIST FE Lab will be sufficient to contain his great ambitions.

news.title: Prof. Lee Joins JFDS Editorial Board
news.title_kr: 이용재 교수, JFDS Editorial Board 입성
news.summary: Professor Yongjae Lee has been appointed to the Editorial Board of the Journal of Finance and Data Science.
news.content:
The Journal of Financial Data Science is an academic journal newly launched in 2019 by Portfolio Management Research to promote financial data science research. It is co-edited by Professor Frank J. Fabozzi, a world-renowned expert in fixed-income, along with Marcos Lopez de Prado and Joseph Simonian, who are leading the application of machine learning in the financial industry, education, and research.[figure1]

[figure2]

news.title: Undergraduate Interns Win Excellence Award at DB Financial Competition
news.title_kr: 학부 연구인턴 윤창희 & 손준호 2019 DB 금융제안공모전 우수상 (2등) 수상
news.summary: Undergraduate research interns Changhee Yoon and Junho Son won the Excellence Award (2nd place) at the 2019 DB Financial Proposal Competition.
news.content:
[figure1]

Undergraduate research interns Changhee Yoon and Junho Son, who were the first to knock on the door of UNIST FE Lab, participated in the 2019 DB Financial Proposal Competition with the topic "Personalized Financial Health Check-up through Big Data Analysis" and won the Excellence Award (2nd place).

Congratulations!
